name: raffishly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is careless and attractive, and does not follow the usual social standards of behaviour or appearance: A raffishly handsome American thirty-something came up and introduced himself. He makes a broad gesture with his hand and grins raffishly.
More examplesFewer examplesI ate at a raffishly arty cafe near the river Seine.He looks every inch the rock star: a leather jacket, fancy trainers, raffishly fringed hair.These photos in which they're so casually and raffishly depicted distort the grim reality of the situation.
